summary: Email correspondence from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York regarding a photo review/exhibit project. The email requests assistance in identifying the source disk or device for 51 photographs and seeks to schedule a call to discuss the project.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, working on a photo review/exhibit project, likely related to the Epstein case, and seeking assistance in identifying the source of photographs.

events.title: Initial discussion of photo review project
events.description: An email was sent to discuss a game plan for the photo review/exhibit project.

events.title: Follow-up on photo source identification
events.description: Email sent to confirm the source disk or device for 51 photographs from the photo review project and to schedule a call.

keyFacts: The document is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York dated September 15, 2021.
It references a photo review/exhibit project involving 51 photographs that require identification of their source disk or device.
The email indicates ongoing investigative work related to photograph evidence, likely in the Epstein case.
A paralegal prepared a spreadsheet detailing a subset of photographs from the photo review project.
The correspondence seeks to schedule a call to discuss the project further, highlighting collaborative efforts in evidence management.
